author: Staff Reporter
text:
With heat stress expected to affect poultry birds, farmers were asked to supplement feed with electrolytes and amino acids.

A press release from Agromet Field Unit of the Veterinary College and Research Institute and Regional Meteorological Centre, Chennai, said that maximum and minimum temperatures are expected to be 98.6 degree Fahrenheit and 75.2 degree Fahrenheit respectively in the next four days.

Temperature

As the day and night temperatures are expected to increase slightly, there will be heat stress and reduction in egg production.

Summer

stress

Hence, farmers should supplement feed with electrolytes and amino acids so as to protect the birds from summer stress and also to maintain egg size and production.

Also, post- mortem observations in the birds brought for diagnostic purpose at Poultry Disease Diagnosis and Surveillance Laboratory at the institute revealed that death is due to Ranikhet disease and heat stress. Hence, farmers are asked to follow bio-security measures and summer management.
title: Poultry farmers asked to supplement feed with amino acids
